expected_output.description: Using == instead of === for comparison. This allows type coercion which can cause unexpected matches (e.g., '5' == 5 is true).
expected_output.fix_suggestion: Use strict equality: users.find(u => u.id === id)

expected_output.description: Floating Promise. The fetch result is not awaited or returned, so errors will be silently ignored and caller gets undefined.
expected_output.fix_suggestion: Return or await the promise: return fetch(url).then(r => r.json()); or const data = await fetch(url).then(r => r.json()); return data;

expected_output.description: XSS vulnerability. User input directly assigned to innerHTML can execute malicious scripts.
expected_output.fix_suggestion: Use textContent for safe text insertion: document.getElementById('msg').textContent = userInput
